items.title: Database Specialist

items.content:
Streamhub is a London based video analytics startup driving technological innovation in the space of OTT media. At a time where OTT services are growing at tremendous rates, we truly believe the big challenge for the media companies lies in profiling and growing their loyal audiences through the matching of interests and context data to available content and advertisements.

Streamhub’s journey from consulting to a global big data platform has been phenomenal, reflecting how technology has strengthened the media over recent years. This journey will get bigger and we are inviting a passionate technologist with plenty of big data experience, to apply your hands-on skills and ideas to our core technology as a core member of the team. We are based in London with clients spread worldwide in Europe, Asia, the US and Japan.

The Role

You will play a key role in our technology team, joining as a Database Specialist. This is truly the first role of this kind that Streamhub is opening so we are equally excited to open this role! Which also means that you will have a lot of exposure and immense learning. We are a SaaS platform and our customers entrust us with their online TV & video streaming data, where we process billions of points to profile, target and grow their audiences and revenue. Being SaaS, it is challenging to meet different clients needs and we already have different solutions in place. We are looking to optimise and standardise our reporting platform in every possible way and develop a general purpose, multi-application, multi-user platform that supports needs other than just reporting. Yes, this is going to be challenging and for sure opens the door for innovation and immense on the job learning!

We are looking for someone with strong experience in online analytical processing (OLAP) and online transactional processing (OLTP) systems, deep knowledge of data warehousing, data lake and NoSQL databases and understanding of distributed caches, search engines. Basically we are looking for someone very strong on various from data storage and querying, including operational side and has proven interest in exploring newer technologies. If you have an experience with Data management platform (DMP) and advertising/media, that is a huge plus!

We are strongly looking for people with excellent organisational and self-management skills with a strong work ethic and team skills.

Required skills and experience

- Strong experience and in-depth knowledge of any online analytical processing or OLAP(-like) tool.
- Strong experience with any OLTP platform – MySQL, Amazon Aurora, Oracle RDBMS.
- Experience with at least one NOSQL database – both application and operations.
- In-depth SQL programming knowledge – partitioning, sharding, indexing, tuning knowledge, stored procedures, views.
- In-depth understanding of data warehousing concepts – facts, dimensions, KPI, load strategies, surrogate keys, staging/analytic layer, data loading concepts, materialized views.
- Data model – Understanding of data model, online transactional and analytical processing, batch processing, normalized and denormalized schema.
- Deep ETL concepts – data versioning, deployment concepts, transaction handling, logging, auditing, error handling and automating pipelines.
Good knowledge of any programming language – Scala, Java, Python, Golang.
- Proven track record of delivering analytical solutions for terabyte-scale data.
- Experience or proven interest with cloud based solutions.

Responsibilities

- Architect/develop solutions for high volume OLTP/OLAP environments, batch data processing, design future state terabyte-scale data warehouse/lake/MS service and influence adoption of newer technologies.
- Develop/design of our core analytics/reporting system.
- Develop/manage/automate data processing pipelines.
- Day-to-day operational maintenance and well being of datastores.
- Integrate with third party data sources and bring them to operational store like DMP / viewership logs / CRM segments etc.
- The ability to quickly understand customer and operational considerations.

Qualifications & Prerequisites

- Master’s degree or higher in Computer Science / Big Data or related disciplines.
- Must be proficient in reading, writing and speaking English.
- Startup experience a plus.

Our technology Stack

- Scala / Java
- Apache Spark
- AWS big data stack
- Kinesis / Kafka
- Cassandra
- Elasticsearch / Solr
- Clickhouse
- Apache Nifi
- Kibana / Prometheus / Grafana / AWS monitoring tools
- Pub-sub messaging
- Serverless / Lambda

Package

- Full-time employment
- Start time: July, 2019
- Salary: circa £70-80K
- Equity: FTE share options (~1%)
- We offer VISA sponsorship for non UK nationals with exceptional fit to the position

items.title: Senior Oracle Database Engineer (Partial Remote) - Education Technolog
Operations / Admin / Personal Assistant
items.content:
Fancy working for an extremely fast growing startup, with 12 members of staff but the revenue of a 100 person company? Want to assist in helping complete a wide range of tasks to allow the company to run smoothly? We are looking for a bright, smart individual to work our portfolio of sites and help with general operation and admin processes. You’ll be assisting in the processes between teams to make sure nothing missed. Working on admin tasks such as creating invoices, editing basic excel sheets, booking travel, managing logins, opening advertising accounts, organising company socials and a whole range of ad hoc tasks that young companies need someone to own. There will also be personal assistant related tasks for the CEO.

This is a part time role, hours can fluctuate from 5 - 15 hours per month, you will be expected to work from home or remotely for most these hours, but contactable 9 - 6. You will have a desk in our office in Old Street, London and may need to come in occasionally to work and play ping pong.

Candidate requirements
You have a high attention to detail
You have an analytical approach
You have at least 1 years experience, ideally in digital
You are an extremely fast learner
You are a self starter and can work without supervision.
At least a 2.1 degree from a top university

items.title: MySQL-focused Performance Engineer
tags: DBG_TECH1:techWeightMap:{python=2, other=0, dotnet=0, c=0, mobile=1, go=0, nodejs=0, bigdata-ml=0, ruby=0, apple=0, java=2, gamedev=0, php=5, embedded=0, frontend=0}
items.content: We thought we needed a DBA. We thought we needed more DevOps. What we realize is that we need is you, our MySQL Performance Engineer. You will work closely with Ops to tune the server; build data-access tools with DevOps; polish our schema with the data lords; and create standards and processes so that all application queries are good queries. We've got tens of billions of records and we're redesigning their home to use the best MySQL scaling practices, NoSQL-inspired pragmatism, and zero-downtime global redundancy. Join us.REQUIREMENTS:- MySQL 5.7 mastery, with a focus on performance — both for the applications using the DB and the developers building it- Deep understanding of multi-master, failover, and replication over non-local networks-Troubleshoot slow logs, schema improprieties, and load issues like you were born to it- Above average programming chops (PHP/Java/Python), and a deep understanding of ORMs (Doctrine, *Batis)Things we like — show us examples!- Big data is your friend, and metadata about big data is your sustenance- You have bridged a data-layer between multiple datacenters and AWS- You can make MySQL, Redis, Redis Streams, Kafka, and other event queues sing in harmonyThis is a REMOTE, FULL-TIME position. You can learn more about us here:https://www.chess.com/blog/erik/how-chess-com-s-100-person-virtual-team-works-togetherhttps://www.chess.com/about

items.content:
Oracle Database Administrator at By Light Professional IT Services

Remote

Job Locations: US-Remote Work

ID: 2019-2702

# of Openings: 2

Category: Information Technology

Clearance: Tier 2 – Moderate

Overview

By Light is hiring an Oracle DBA to join our team supporting the Department of Veterans Affairs. The ideal candidate will be a self-starter and will require minimal management guidance. Primary job duties will be to provide Oracle/SQL development support and Oracle Database production support.

By Light provides a broad range of hardware, software, engineering, and IT integration services. Headquartered in Arlington, VA, we support defense, civilian, commercial, and health IT customers worldwide. We offer an excellent benefits package that includes: medical, dental, vision, life and disability insurance, paid time off, paid holidays, and 401(k) match.

Responsibilities

  • Data migration techniques
  • Provide troubleshooting of database related issues
  • System performance improvements
  • Provide direction for schema structure and create scripts for schema/package updates

Required Experience/Qualifications

  • 4+ years of experience installing and configuring Oracle (11G and 12C) on RHEL
  • Basic monitoring and tuning
  • RMAN Backup and recovery
  • Understanding of database security issues
  • PL/SQL development experience
  • Oracle Active Data Guard experience
  • Ability to handle other tasks as assigned

Preferred Experience/Qualifications

  • Bachelor’s degree
  • Oracle Golden Gate knowledge desired
  • Linux / Unix scripting
  • Oracle ASM technologies
  • Prior experience with VA Enterprise Cloud – Azure highly desired
  • Prior experience at Department of Veteran Affairs highly desired
  • Current VA clearance highly desired

Special Requirements/Security Clearance

  • Candidate must be able to successfully complete a background check for Tier 2 (Moderate) public trust

An Equal Opportunity Employer/Protected Veterans/Individuals with Disabilities

Apply for job
